title: The Androids of Tara
dialogue_triumphs: Would you mind not standing on my chest, my hat's on fire?
They always want you to go alone when you're walking into a trap, have you noticed that?
To K-9, cutting a door: 'A hamster with a blunt penknife could do it quicker!'
Grendel's parting riposte as he leaps from the castle battlements: 'Next time, I shall not be so lenient!'
goofs: Romana's restraints appear easy to escape from.
Reynart's throne is recognizable as Tim's chair from The Goodies.
In episode three, when the Doctor enters the Pavillion of the Summer Winds and shuts the door, it slowly swings open again. A hand then appears from behind the set wall and pulls the door closed.

locations.name: Tara
locations.description: A planet with a monarchy and advanced android technology
locations.current_status: Recovering from a plague that wiped out nine-tenths of the population 200 years ago

future_history: The story is set approximately in the 2370s, as Romana mentions the TARDIS has travelled 400 years in time.
untold_adventures: The Doctor saw Capablanca play Alekhine at chess in 1927 in Buenos Aires
The Doctor met Izaak Walton, author of The Compleat Angler
additional_notes: Fashion oddities include the Archimandrite's hat, a British general at the coronation, and Lamia's 70s-style boots. There are several double entendres in the dialogue.
bottom_line: Wonderful, Doctor Who as heroic romance, with plenty of swashbuckling, wit and color. The final duel is particularly praised, with Tom Baker at the height of his powers. The story is noted for its small stakes and charming nature.
